page.title: 17WHITELEAS ALLOTMENTS
page.content: Whiteleas Allotments are situated north east of Whiteleas J.M.I.School behind the Holder House Estate. They are owned by South Tyneside Council and rented from them by different kinds of people, mainly pensioners. There are 275 plots altogether. The plots are organised into 2 separate areas. In one area people keep poultry and birds like hens,budgies and pigeons. Pigeon racing is a popular sport amongst the pigeon owners. In the second area people grow many kinds of vegetables and flowers,e.g.show leeks,green beans,tomatoes,sweetpeas and chrysanthemums.
